channel.title: .G.E. Saving
channel.description:
Alright, so I've developed my own .Grand.Exchange. No it's not the real one, it's a custom one.
But, I have all the saving down. I created a saving method to where it'll save to a directory. Then at login, when the player logins in it'll load all buy/sell offers that were saved.
But, if the server were to get restarted, then the sell/buy offers wouldn't beable to be loaded again, at all.
This part I need help with :(

item.title: .G.E. Saving
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

I’m not sure how it’s done, but you can make it load like character files loads and saves.

Basically the idea is that every offer has it’s own ID, if an item is being sold, it occupies the ID it’s given, with a price range.
If an item is being bought, it searches for the ID of the item the person wants to buy, takes the offer ID, removes it from the list (creating a vacant spot for another item to use), and adds the item to the players pack if he met the price range set by the seller.

An example of this is

Sell ID-Item ID-Price-PlayerName

Sell = 1 1050 2000000 +playerName Sell = 2 1050 2100000 +playerName

If a person offers an amount closer to Sell = 1, than Sell = 2, it will take off Sell = 1 from the list, giving the player who bought it an item with the ID of 1050 (Santa Hat).

After removing Sell = 1 from the list, it should look like this now.

Sell = 2	1050	2100000	+playerName

And if someone wants to sell something else, it’ll replace Sell = 1, instead of creating useless spots. And you can probably make an method where you can search for Sell ID’s if people wanna buy from a specific person.

I’m not too skilled at Java, but I’m pretty sure this is possible.

Read full topic

item.description:
@the_soul wrote:
